model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: I feel so grateful to have a boss who is always so supportive of me.
Co-workers B: That's amazing to hear. Having a supportive boss can make all the difference in how you feel about your job.
Co-workers A: Definitely. It makes me feel secure in my position and motivated to do my best work.
Co-workers B: It's great to have that kind of positive reinforcement. Do you remember when we were working on that movie together and you were feeling really frustrated?
Co-workers A: Oh yeah, I remember. I was so angry after blowing up that rabbit with the dynamite. But talking it out with you really helped me work through my emotions.
Co-workers B: That's right. It's important to have someone to talk to when you're feeling overwhelmed or upset.
Co-workers A: And speaking of talking it out, do you remember when I was a kid and I ran to our parents screaming because of that spider?

[MEMORY]
1. [Co-worker B was nervous about working with Co-worker A because of their talent as an actor.] - (Causes) - [Co-worker B emphasized the importance of learning from mistakes and working together as a team.] - (React) - [Co-worker B acknowledges that some people have fears and suggests finding healthy ways to deal with frustrations.]

2. [Co-worker A and Co-worker B met on a movie set and are now good friends.] - (SameTopic) - [Co-worker A felt remorse for what they did and appreciated Co-worker B's understanding.] - (React) - [Co-worker A has grown as a person and as an artist, learning about empathy and compassion.]

3. [Both Co-worker A and Co-worker B feel that their collaboration brought out the best in each other during the shoot.] - (React) - [Co-worker A had a tough week on set, feeling overwhelmed and chaotic.] - (React) - [Co-worker A mentions a past event involving blowing up a rabbit with dynamite, indicating a history of poor coping mechanisms for frustration.]
